channel.title: Custom weblclient question. Answer please!
channel.description: Alright so, I am tired of searching up free ways to make a webclient, and only coming across these sites where you have to pick a certain client that's already on there, and using that, is there ANY possible way to make a custom webclient myself, on my own site? Like if I were to use a webs.com site or something like that, and make a custom html page, is there any way i could get it to load on there? please someone help.

item.title: Custom weblclient question. Answer please!
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

First of all, all web clients are free. All clients are made through a program called JARMaker or a simple command through your CMD Prompt. Yes, you can host your web client off your website, but I suggest not using webs. Webs is known to cut off applications that are larger than so many dimensions and it gets annoying as a part of the game screen is gone. You can find many tutorials regarding this topic alone as it is a easy concept to understand. Hope you find this thread informative.

Read full topic
